title: Graphic output of AST and ASR
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/329

The motivation is well explained in these two threads (with screenshots, etc.):

https://twitter.com/cfbolz/status/1386315196982079491

I can see three ways to do this:

* Write automatic JSON export of AST/ASR in `asdl_cpp.py`, then write tools either in C++ or Python to take the JSON and provide visualization (perhaps in a web browser).
* We already have a serialization / deserialization, we can generate a deserialization Python code in `asdl_cpp.py` that can then visualize it
* We can generate the graphviz export visitor in `asdl_cpp.py`.

The JSON route seems the most versatile, as any language has a JSON reader, so LFortran simply generates JSON, and then we can write a tool in Python or JavaScript to create a graph out of this.
